chapter.title: Contextual help
chapter.para: Among the links located on the top right of the PMB management interface, the question mark "?" allows the display of PMB contextual help.
The contextual help can be enabled or disabled by setting the PMB parameter with sub-type show_help. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide.

sect1.title: Availability of the contextual help
sect1.para: The contextual help is available in French only at the moment. English, Italian and Spanish translations are in preparation. For more information, do not hesitate to ask about these versions, go to our news list: pmb.user@sigb.net (to subscribe send an e-mail to pmb.user_request@sigb.net with SUBSCRIBE in the subjectline.

sect1.title: How the contextual help works
sect1.para: The contextual help is displayed in a pop-up. The help displayed corresponds to your management interface screen.
The contextual help integrates the Administrator's Guide, the User's Guide and the Installation Guide within PMB.
On top of every page, you have several elements :

listitem.para: the title of the chapter on screen
the section's title of the chapter on screen
navigation arrows enabling you to go from one page to another to browse the help.

sect1.para: At the bottom of each page, you will find various navigation icons.

figure.title: Contextual help, bottom page navigation icons

sect1.para: The left and right arrows enable you to browse the help by moving from one page to another.
The top arrow is a link to the summary of the chapter on screen. Among the chapter titles of the User Guide, you can find the tabs Circulation, Cataloguing, Authority and Reporting.
The "home" icon is a link to the summary of the currently displayed guide : the Administrator's Guide, the User's Guide and the Installation Guide.

sect1.title: Default operation
sect1.para: Installing the contextual help is done by integrating a zip archive containing all of the documentation into the PMB install directory. It is available at www.sigb.net

If the PMB administrator has not correctly installed the default contextual help, the link to the contextual help "?" will redirect you to the install files and to the settings found in the doc sub-folder of your PMB installation.
In this case, contact your PMB administrator or read carefully the installation procedure. The latter is displayed in the pop-up under the links to the documentation files of the PMB installation.
